quotes.quote: Gold cannot be pure, and people cannot be perfect.
Have no fear of perfection ' you'll never reach it.
Better to do something imperfectly than to do nothing flawlessly.
Imperfection clings to a person, and if they wait till they are brushed off entirely, they would spin for ever on their axis, advancing nowhere.
Nothing and no one is perfect. It just takes a good eye to find those hidden imperfections.
Imperfection is beauty. Madness is genius. It is better to be absolutely ridiculous than absolutely boring.
As machines become more and more efficient and perfect, so it will become clear that imperfection is the greatness of man.
I cling to my imperfection, as the very essence of my being.
You look at the scratch and completely miss the diamond.
To be perfect is to develop expanding imperfection.
It is better to aim at perfection and miss, than to aim at imperfection and hit it.
There is no excellent beauty that hath not some strangeness in the proportion.
A diamond with a flaw is worth more than a pebble without imperfections.
Sometimes we strive so hard for perfection that we forget that imperfection is happiness.
Even imperfection itself may have its ideal or perfect state.
It is better to aim at perfection and miss, than to aim at imperfection and hit it
Where imperfection ceaseth, heaven begins.
Men are more unwilling to have their imperfections known than their crimes.
What an absurd thing it is to pass over all the valuable parts of a man, and fix our attention on his infirmities!
It is only imperfection that complains of what is imperfect. The more perfect we are, the more gentle and quiet we become towards the defects of others.
All things are literally better, lovelier, and more beloved for the imperfections which have been divinely appointed, that the law of human life may be Effort, and the law of human judgment Mercy.
The only nice thing about being imperfect is the joy it brings to others.
I never expect to see a perfect work from an imperfect man.
Imperfect preparation gives rise to the thousand-fold forms that express physical and mental inferiority and insecurity.
Perfectionism is a dangerous state of mind in an imperfect world
Once we realize that imperfect understanding is the human condition there is no shame in being wrong, only in failing to correct our mistakes.
If I can't be beautiful, I want to be invisible.
A true critic ought to dwell upon excellencies rather than imperfections, to discover the concealed beauties of a writer, and communicate to the world such things as are worth their observation.
This is the very perfection of a man, to find out his own imperfections.
My imperfections and failures are as much a blessing from God as my successes and my talents and I lay them both at his feet.
There is a kind of beauty in imperfection
Instead of waiting for perfection, run with what you do, and fix it along the way...
In order to go on living one must try to escape the death involved in perfectionism.
Perfection is boring. If a face doesn't have mistakes, it's nothing.
We like the imperfect because it reminds us of ourselves.
To do better is better than to be perfect.

Imperfection is in some sort essential to all that we know of life. It is the sign of life in a mortal body, that is to say, of a state of progress and change. Nothing that lives is, or can be rigidly perfect; part of it is decaying, part nascent.
The finer the nature, the more flaws it will show through the clearness of it; and it is a law of this universe that the best things shall be seldomest seen in their best form.
No reckoning made, but sent to my account with all my imperfections on my head.
They say that nobody is perfect. Then they tell you practice makes perfect. I wish they'd make up their minds.
A beautiful thing is never perfect.
The essence of being human is that one does not seek perfection.
Perfection doesn't guarantee success. You don't have to be perfect to succeed.
Imperfection is inherited, therefore we all sin, but fighting the war of sin is the greatest war of all because we all die in the end, no matter how hard we fight.
Imperfection is individuality.
Be real. Embrace that you have weakness. Because everyone does. Embrace that your body is not perfect. Because nobody's is. Embrace that you have things you can't control. We all have a list of them.
To banish imperfection is to destroy expression, to check exertion, to paralyze vitality.
Imperfections are not inadequacies; they are reminders that we're all in this together.
To be judged for your imperfections is to be judged for being human, mistakes are made, life goes on, don't let other people change who you are.
Practice doesn't make perfect. Practice reduces the imperfection.
Do not lose courage in considering your own imperfections.
In nature, nothing is perfect and everything is perfect. Trees can be contorted, bent in weird ways, and they're still beautiful.
The day the child realizes that all adults are imperfect, he becomes an adolescent; the day he forgives them, he becomes an adult; the day he forgives himself, he becomes wise.
To sit in judgment of those things which you perceive to be wrong or imperfect is to be one more person who is part of judgment, evil or imperfection.
Nothing we see or hear is perfect. But right there in the imperfection is perfect reality.
Imperfection is in some sort essential to all that we know of life.
Being happy doesn't mean that everything is perfect. It means that you've decided to look beyond the imperfections.
Have no fear of perfection. You'll never reach it.
Perhaps it is our imperfections that make us so perfect for one another.
I know why families were created with all their imperfections. They humanize you. They are made to make you forget yourself occasionally, so that the beautiful balance of life is not destroyed.
Imperfection is not our personal problem - it is a natural part of existing.
No one thing does human life more need than a kind consideration of the faults of others. Every one sins; everyone needs forbearance. Our own imperfections should teach us to be merciful.
Persuade thyself that imperfection and inconvenience are the natural lot of mortals, and there will be no room for discontent, neither for despair.
The more perfect we are, the more gentle and quiet we become toward the defects of other people.
Without imperfection, you or I would not exist.
Your imperfections are what make you beautiful.
Better to do something imperfectly than to do nothing perfectly.
It belongs to the imperfection of everything human that man can only attain his desire by passing through its opposite.
Persuade thyself that imperfection and inconvenience are the natural lot of mortals, and there will be no room for discontent, neither for despair.
It is only imperfection that complains of what is imperfect. The more perfect we are the more gentle and quiet we become toward the defects of others.
The perfect human being is uninteresting the Buddha who leaves the world, you know. It is the imperfections of life that are lovable.
The imperfections of others never release us from the need to work on our own shortcomings.
We can never attain to perfection while we have an affection for any imperfection.
The more perfect one becomes, the less he is inclined to speak of the imperfections of others.
Occupy yourself in beholding and bewailing your own imperfections rather than contemplating the imperfections of others.
There is no light without shadow, and no psychic wholeness without imperfection.
We come to love not by finding the perfect person, but by learning to see an imperfect person perfectly.
I think perfection is ugly. Somewhere in the things humans make, I want to see scars, failure, disorder, distortion.
A true critic ought to dwell rather upon excellencies than imperfections.
Imperfections are attractive when their owners are happy with them.
Producing perfection from imperfection is, after all, the highest of art forms.
